definition: Sports involving direct physical confrontation or simulated fighting between opponents.

positive_examples: The boxing match ended in a knockout in the third round.
She earned her black belt in karate after years of training.
The wrestling tournament featured competitors from around the world.
He practiced his sword techniques at the fencing academy.
The mixed martial arts fighter submitted his opponent with a chokehold.
The judo throw sent her opponent flying across the mat.
negative_examples: The football team scored a touchdown in the final seconds.
She hit a perfect serve to win the tennis match.
The basketball player made a three-point shot from downtown.
He swam the butterfly stroke in the Olympic finals.
The soccer goalie made an incredible diving save.
The track athlete broke the world record in the 100 meters.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TeamSports, RacketSports, WaterSports, TrackAndField
